intro: Vachellia caven, commonly known as the African broom, is a shrub or small tree native to sub-Saharan Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, exhibiting drought resistance through its deep root system. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, attracting pollinators such as bees and birds. Vachellia caven is also valued for its use in traditional medicine and as a source of fuelwood.
